content:
I have devised a step-by-step algorithm to decode the provided DNA sequences into a readable sentence. To execute this algorithm, I need to convert it into a runnable script. For this purpose, I will use the `Code` agent.

The `Code` agent will take the detailed algorithm I've created and translate it into Python code. Here’s why I’m choosing this agent and how I’ll configure its parameters:

- **`code_request_id`**: This parameter requires the file ID of the experimental procedure to be transformed into code. I will provide the file ID of the protocol I just generated (`Protocol-54c3`), which contains the complete DNA decoding algorithm.
- **`pure_software`**: This flag indicates that the task is purely software-based and does not require any physical hardware. Since the decoding process is a computational task involving data manipulation, I will set this to `True`.
- **`multiple_inputs`**: This parameter is for tasks that require multiple different inputs. In this case, I have only one set of DNA sequences to decode, so I will leave this parameter empty.
- **`inputs_from_previous_stage`**: This parameter is used to pass information from a previous stage if `multiple_inputs` is not used. The input for this stage is the list of 78 DNA sequences. I will pass this information to the `Code` agent so it can be embedded directly into the generated script.
